name: Mariusz Jan Skobel
profile_summary:
Machine Learning Engineer with 10+ years of experience in software development and a solid foundation in **Python**, **AWS** (including **S3**, **Lambda**, and **Redshift**), and **SQL**. Proficient in **MLOps**, including managing ML pipelines and deploying models using **scikit-learn**, **TensorFlow**, and **PyTorch**. Expertise in **Kubernetes** for containerization and orchestration, along with a strong grasp of data ETL processes. Demonstrated ability to apply software engineering best practices such as version control, thorough testing, and troubleshooting to ensure reliable and maintainable solutions. Skilled in collaborative communication and strategic collaboration within cross-functional teams.

Possesses hands-on experience building high-performance applications in healthcare and finance, including capabilities in cloud-native development on **AWS**. A proven track record of embedding AI/ML capabilities for real-time analytics and automation, with a focus on compliance standards such as HIPAA and PCI DSS. Passionate about leveraging technology to create impactful systems that meet business needs and foster continuous improvement.

• Implemented software engineering best practices across the development lifecycle, emphasizing testing frameworks such as **Jest**, **Cypress**, **PyTest**, and **Postman** for quality assurance and reliability.
• Utilized **Kubernetes** for container orchestration, ensuring efficient deployment of applications showcasing scalable architecture managing over 50 concurrent users in production.
• Collaborated closely with cross-functional teams, enhancing communication to integrate innovative AI features into applications to provide strategic advantages in financial insights and healthcare recommendations.
• Developed advanced search features using **ElasticSearch** and **Azure Cognitive Search** to enable swift retrieval of millions of documents, increasing operational efficiency by **30%**.
• Established version control practices utilizing **Git** to monitor code changes and maintain collaborative workflows across teams, facilitating easier rollback and feature implementation.
